feed.title: Jake Zimmerman | Recitation
feed.subtitle: A collection of blog posts about programming, software, types, programming languages, Sorbet, Vim, Markdown, and more.

entry.title: Notes on Continuations
entry.summary: Some recitation notes on continuations from when I was a teaching assistant for 15-312 at CMU.

entry.title: System Fω and Parameterization
entry.summary: Some recitation-style notes on System F, polymorphism, and functions. I used to not know the difference between ∀(t.τ) and λ(u.c). Turns out, there's a huge difference!

entry.title: Variables in Types
entry.summary: Having variables in our type systems lends a great deal of power to languages using these type systems. We’re going to look at how variables are used in generic programming, inductive & coinductive types, and polymorphic types.

entry.title: Recitation Notes
entry.summary: Old habits die hard; I'm still pretending to be a teaching assistant even though I'm not anymore.
